intro: Lopezia conjugans, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its basal rosette of blue-green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, wind-dispersed seeds. Lopezia conjugans is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that help it survive in dry conditions. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
